Class Doctor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Doctor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Doctor
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The Doctor class is the class that creates the doctor. The user can get a health check up for their critter or buy medicine if the critter is ill. Here, there will be information on the critter's nutrition if the user chooses to view them on the clipboard for the health check up.
    Version:
    5 06.09.15 Time Spent by Jasmine Ou: 30 minutes. Time Spent by Laura Wong: 20 hours.

    name: Doctor.java

    Instance variables:

    sick This is a boolean variable that indicates if the critter is sick or not.

    askDialog This is a JDialog that has the ask dialog to ask the user if they want to exit or et a check-up.

    okPushed This boolean variable is used to indicate if the ok button was pushed or not.

    ok This is the ok button used in the good bye dialog.

    talkingDoctor This string variable is used to save the first part of the doctor's text.

    talkingDoctor2 This string variable is used to save the second part of the doctor's text.

    talkingDoctor3 This string variable is used to save the third part of the doctor's text.

    talkingDoctor4 This string variable is used to save the fourth part of the doctor's text.

    counter This int variable is used to indicate when the user pushes the ok button.

    yesButton This button is used to indicate that the user wants to check the critter's health.

    exitButton This button is used to indicate that the user wants to exit right after the have seen the critter is healthy or not.

    okButton This button is used when the user has seen the information from the doctor's speech bubble.

    doneButton This button is used when the user is officially out of the doctor's office.

    checkUpArray This String 2D array stores the certain meal's percentages and the certain meal's value of "too little", "too much" or "".

    startAgain This is a boolean variable used to check to see if the doctor should start again from the beginning.

    Author:
    Laura Wong
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        The start method is used to set the doctor's text to the first message he tells the user, it also resets counter to 0.

      • reportToPatient

        public void reportToPatient()
        The reportToPatient method is used to display the text on screen on speech bubble of doctor based on health check results. The if statement is used to check to see if the critter is sick or not and create a different message depending on if they are sick or not.

      • askExit

        public void askExit()
        The askExit method is used to ask the user if they want to exit the game or get a check-up.

        Local Variables

        yesOrExit This JButton array is used to store the 2 buttons that will be in the askOptionPane.

        askOptionPane This JOptionPane is used to ask the user if they want to exit or to get a check-up.

      • beforeCheckUp

        public void beforeCheckUp()
        The beforeCheckUP method is used to set the doctor's speech to something before the clipboard comes up.

      • checkUpHealth

        public void checkUpHealth()
        The checkUpHealth method is used to load the the values from the balanced array in critter home to to checkup array with the percentages and whether it has been fed too little, too much or just enough. The for loop is used to run 6 times to check all 6 meals. The if statements are used to see if the balanced array is equal to "too little", "too much" or "".

        Local Variables

        x This is the variable to be used inside the for loops.

      • setButtonsActionListener

        public void setButtonsActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
        The setButtonsActionListener method adds an ActionListener to each button and sets their action commands.
        Parameters:
        al - is the ActionListener passed in to be added to the buttons.

      • talkToPatient

        public void talkToPatient()
        The talkToPatient method is used if the critter is healthy and needs random insights of knowledge. The first if statement is used to see if the critter is sick or not. If they are not sick, the doctor will give the critter random knowledge and "fun-facts". This leads to the next if statement that is used to indicate if the random number genereated equals to any of those values and changes the doctor's text to something else to say. If they are sick, it will ask them if they want to purchase instant medication. This goes to the next if statement which indicates if the answer to the user's JOptionPane if they would like to buy medication is yes or no (0 being yes and 2 being no) If they choose yes, another if statement is used to see if the user has more than or equal to 25 points to pay for the medication, if they do, the crittr is cured, if not then there is another JOptionPane telling them they don't have enough. The last if is used to see if the user clicked the "No" button for buying medication, it will output yet another JOptionPane saying how to make their critter healthy again.

        Local Variables

        number This int variable is used to create a random number.

        option This is an int variable to store what the user clicks in the JOptionPane.

      • drawExit

        public void drawExit()
        The drawExit method is used to create the done button in the clipboard part.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        The exit method is used to exit the game when the user is done their check-up. The if statement is used to make sure that the exit method only appears once because counter is equal to 4.

      • setStartAgain

        public void setStartAgain(boolean newStartAgain)
        The setStartAgain method is used to set the boolean variable of startAgain..
        Parameters:
        newStartAgain - is the new boolean variable value to change startAgain to.

      • setCounter

        public void setCounter(int newCounter)
        The setCounter method is used to set the boolean variable of counter..
        Parameters:
        newCounter - is the new boolean variable value to change counter to.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This paintComponent method is an overriden method and it is used to draw the background images and draw the strings on the screen. The first if statement is used to see if the critter is sick or not and draw a specific picture, the next if statement is used to save the sick variable as true or false. The next if statment is inside the okButton inside it's actionPerformed is to see if the boolean variable startAgain is true or not to start the whole process over again. The next if statement is also inside the okButton inside it's actionPerformed that has been added to the button. It checks to see what the counter variable is equal to and draws something different for each one. The next if statement is used to see if okPushed is true or false because then it means the last ok button was pushed. The for loop inside this if statement is used to draw the different squares on the clipboard. The if statement inside the for loop is used to see if the value is equal to "too much", "too little" or "".

        Instance variables:

        healthyImage This image is used for the healthy critter.

        sickImage This image is used for the sick critter.

        clipboard This image is used to draw the clipboard.

        x This is the variable to be used in the for loop.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - This is the graphics variable used to draw onto the JPanel screen.
